snippet: Some supporters of military intervention in Syria argue that there might be more to learn from the United States-led bombing campaign that helped to end the brutal sectarian civil war in Bosnia in 1995 than from the American invasion of Iraq in 2003.
abstract: Some supporters of military intervention in Syria argue that there might be more to learn from the United States-led bombing campaign that helped to end the brutal sectarian civil war in Bosnia in 1995 than from the American invasion of Iraq in 2003.

headline.main: Looking at Syria and Seeing Bosnia, Not Iraq

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
